channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Trump administration backs off requiring response to 'What did you do last week?' email
item.description: "No one knows what we are supposed to do," said one federal employee amid conflicting and shifting directives on whether to comply with Elon Musk's directive to list five accomplishments.
item.content:encoded:
"No one knows what we are supposed to do," said one federal employee amid conflicting and shifting directives on whether to comply with Elon Musk's directive to list five accomplishments.

(Image credit: Tasos Katopodis)
item.dc:creator: Shannon Bond

item.title: Court ruling lets White House ban on the Associated Press continue, for now
item.description: The Trump administration may continue — for now — to keep the AP from covering key events. A federal judge declined to issue a temporary restraining order on Monday.
item.content:encoded:
The Trump administration may continue — for now — to keep the AP from covering key events. A federal judge declined to issue a temporary restraining order on Monday.

(Image credit: JIM WATSON/AFP via Getty Images)
item.dc:creator: David Folkenflik

item.title: Are Trump's military picks based on merit or loyalty?
item.description:
On Friday, Donald Trump fired Chairman of the Joint Chief's of Staff CQ Brown, along with several other top Pentagon officials.

Now, Senator Jack Reed, a Democrat from Rhode Island, has a question for the man tapped to succeed him, Retired Air Force Lieutenant General Dan Caine.

Quote — "will he have the ability to speak truth to power?"
Senator Reed is the top democrat on the Armed Services Committee.

The Trump administration says it wants a military built on meritocracy. Critics say it's building one governed by political loyalty.

For sponsor-free episodes of Consider This, sign up for Consider This+ via Apple Podcasts or at plus.npr.org.

Email us at considerthis@npr.org.
item.content:encoded:
On Friday, Donald Trump fired Chairman of the Joint Chief's of Staff CQ Brown, along with several other top Pentagon officials.

Now, Senator Jack Reed, a Democrat from Rhode Island, has a question for the man tapped to succeed him, Retired Air Force Lieutenant General Dan Caine.

Quote — "will he have the ability to speak truth to power?"
Senator Reed is the top democrat on the Armed Services Committee.

The Trump administration says it wants a military built on meritocracy. Critics say it's building one governed by political loyalty.

For sponsor-free episodes of Consider This, sign up for Consider This+ via Apple Podcasts or at plus.npr.org.

Email us at considerthis@npr.org.

(Image credit: Chip Somodevilla)

item.title: Germany's historic election. And the impact of 3 years of war in Ukraine
item.description: The man poised to become Germany's new Chancellor says the US administration doesn't care about the fate of Europe. And, on the third anniversary of Russia's full-scale invasion of Ukraine what has been the impact of the largest conflict in Europe since the second world war?
item.content:encoded:
The man poised to become Germany's new Chancellor says the US administration doesn't care about the fate of Europe. And, on the third anniversary of Russia's full-scale invasion of Ukraine what has been the impact of the largest conflict in Europe since the second world war?

(Image credit: Marcus Brandt)
item.dc:creator: Tara Neill

item.title: The Panama Canal needs more water. The solution is a dam that could displace thousands
item.description: More than 2,000 people could be displaced by the construction of the Río Indio dam. The Panama Canal Authority says the dam solves a long-term water shortage problem.
item.content:encoded:
More than 2,000 people could be displaced by the construction of the Río Indio dam. The Panama Canal Authority says the dam solves a long-term water shortage problem.

(Image credit: Tomas Ayuso for NPR)
item.dc:creator: Rolando Arrieta

item.title: Medical research labs brace for possible funding cuts that could disrupt their work
item.description: Researchers say the Trump administration's plan to slash payments for indirect costs will hamper new medical science. One example? A lab studying respiratory viruses faces losing half its staff.
item.content:encoded:
Researchers say the Trump administration's plan to slash payments for indirect costs will hamper new medical science. One example? A lab studying respiratory viruses faces losing half its staff.

(Image credit: Rob Stein)
item.dc:creator: Rob Stein

item.title: Federal watchdog agency intervenes in Trump's purge of probationary employees
item.description: U.S. Special Counsel Hampton Dellinger has asked the Merit Systems Protection Board to temporarily reinstate six federal employees fired from their jobs and is considering ways to seek relief for others.
item.content:encoded:
U.S. Special Counsel Hampton Dellinger has asked the Merit Systems Protection Board to temporarily reinstate six federal employees fired from their jobs and is considering ways to seek relief for others.

(Image credit: Alex Wong)
item.dc:creator: Andrea Hsu

item.title: Trump and Macron meet in Washington as Europe pleads for continued help with Ukraine
item.description: During a joint press conference President Trump and French President Emmanuel Macron highlighted their friendly relationship, even when they appeared far apart on the war in Ukraine.
item.content:encoded:
During a joint press conference President Trump and French President Emmanuel Macron highlighted their friendly relationship, even when they appeared far apart on the war in Ukraine.

(Image credit: Ludovic Marin)
item.dc:creator: Franco Ordoñez

item.title: U.S. votes against a U.N. resolution urging Russia's withdrawal from Ukraine
item.description: The European-backed resolution that was approved demands Russia immediately withdraw its forces. The Trump administration had offered a competing resolution that did not mention Russian aggression.
item.content:encoded:
The European-backed resolution that was approved demands Russia immediately withdraw its forces. The Trump administration had offered a competing resolution that did not mention Russian aggression.

(Image credit: Julia Demaree Nikhinson)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: DHS memo lays out plans to detain migrants at Fort Bliss and other U.S. bases
item.description: The Trump administration is developing plans to build immigration detention facilities on bases nationwide, a step that could significantly expand the military's role in immigration enforcement.
item.content:encoded:
The Trump administration is developing plans to build immigration detention facilities on bases nationwide, a step that could significantly expand the military's role in immigration enforcement.

(Image credit: U.S. Army Sgt. 1st Class Nicholas J. De La Pena)
item.dc:creator: Joel Rose
